revised_title: Hearing Mechanism in Crustaceans: Structure and Function
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of the hearing organ in crustaceans. They describe the inner surface of the sac, the distribution of nerves, and the role of siliccous sand particles in regulating the size of grains. The study also discusses variations in the organs of hearing in different crustaceans and mentions another organ at the base of large antennae, which may be related to smell. The paper includes illustrative drawings.
